snippet: The steel shutters on some Lower Manhattan storefronts will provide the canvases for paintings that could truly be considered street art.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; steel shutters found on the front of commercial supply shops along the Bowery are turned into an art show in After Hours 2: Murals on the Bowery; Museum of Modern Art brings Random International piece Rain Room to an abandoned lot by the museum; familiar group of artists are represented in this year's crop of acquisitions by the National Gallery of Art in Washington; Metropolitan Museum of Art offers sneak peak into Leonard A Lauder's landmark collection of Cubist art, promised to the museum.
lead_paragraph: The steel shutters on some Lower Manhattan storefronts will provide the canvases for paintings that could truly be considered street art.

headline.seo: ‘Murals on the Bowery,’ Organized by Art Production Fund
headline.main: ‘Murals on the Bowery,’ Organized by Art Production Fund
